conclusion: Analyze the cyclic process to determine heat exchange Q over one complete cycle.
State A has a temperature of 27°C, converted to 300 K.
Pressure at state A is 1 x 10^5 Pa, Volume at state A is 3 L.
Using Ideal Gas Law, nR is calculated as 1.
Temperature at state B is calculated as 400 K.
Pressure at state B is 1 x 10^5 Pa, Volume at state B is 4 x 10^-3 m^3.
Temperature at state C is calculated as 300 K.
Pressure at state C is 0.75 x 10^5 Pa, Volume at state C is 4 x 10^-3 m^3.
Temperature at state D is calculated as 225 K.
Pressure at state D is 0.75 x 10^5 Pa, Volume at state D is 3 x 10^-3 m^3.
Work done in process A → B is 0 J.
Work done in process B → C is 100 J.
Work done in process C → D is 0 J.
Work done in process D → A is -75 J.
Total work done in the cycle is 25 J.
Using the first law of thermodynamics, heat exchange Q is 25 J.
The heat exchanged with the outside world over one complete cycle is 25 J.
